intro: Chaetogastra violacea, commonly known as the violet starwort, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, violet-colored flowers arranged in a star-like pattern, giving it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
